page.title: 03Thorpe Salvin Church
page.content: {Thorpe Salvin}church is a village church made of{magnesium limestone with a tower.It was built in the reign of{Henry I,}about{1130 AD. Inside the church there are 2{Norman {arches.}The{font}was chiselled out of a block of marble_like stone from{Caen}in France about{1130.}Each carving represents the different seasons .It is one of the{best {examples}of a Norman font in{South {Yorkshire}and probably in the county.The sundial in the church yard is not very old.It was made in{1838}by Robert Rodgers,the village mason.The {chained bible}in{Thorpe Salvin}church was brought for fifty eight shillings at Gainsborough market at Easter time, It is called{Bills bible.}It was brought in{1641.}There is a demon on the beams in the roof.It is meant to protect the church from evil spirits.
